Cada vez que vc joga esse jogo ele vai ficando pior
Probably a real good game if you like impaling people on giant meat hooks.

strongly don't recommend to pay money in any form for this game

rather try other asymetrical games like vhs or propnight

as a player it feels like they take care of their game in a super lazy way

additional monetization in form of cosmetics are way way overpriced, feels like just grabbing as much money as possible before game dies out, a lot of reskins for full price money

balancing is literally nonexistend, nothing ever gets any changes or makeovers, things they claim to have reworked usually just got worse or bandaid fixed

yet they introduce skill based matchmaking nobody asked for, as if this is a competetive game, just to assume this game is in a state to be groundwork to have competitive games in is not only a joke but just offensive to actual competitive games

new content that gets released feels like it never gets tested and is always broken in some way

game is not newcomer friendly, fundamental strategies do not get explained, leveling up and perking out characters takes forever (literally multiple millions of bloodpoints for a basic setup on a few characters) and gets exponentionally more with every new dlc
also the newcomers get thrown together with people that played the game for thousands of hours because their skilled based matchmaking fundamentally just doesnt work
Fun as hell with friends or randoms. They need to make Pennywise one of the killers.

Fun game, bad community. These people will shit talk you for performing game mechanics.

"I LOOPED U FOR HOURS"

That's what Survivors do when you're the last person alive.

Overall a good game with some interesting balance choices that aren't entirely broken though admittedly several maps are. Toxicity means something totally different here, most everyone BMs and stands at the exit gate squat dancing until the killer notices them. I hope it doesn't go the way of For Honor.
Prob the best asymmetrical game imo
The day i saw Cote' promise new content every 3 months was the day I knew this game was going to die.

I like this game a lot. I love that there's two gameplay perspectives which really helps keep the game fresh. When I'm ready for a challenge I like to play killer, but if I'm in a more lackadaisical mood I'll play survivor, and in either case I get to play more DBD, which has been a great way to pass the time.

I'll leave a warning that the learning curve is steep. And you reach a certain ceiling where it gets really hard to get much better without a vast library of perks, namely for killers. The game comes with 5 or so, I think - and by now there's something like 17 killers, all of them with 3 unique perks. So you have to unlock those perks, and then level up a certain killer enough times to get that perk on just that one killer, but then do that for any killers you want that perk for.

It doesn't have to be a complete barrier for entry, you can still do quite well with most of the killers with their base perks. Similarly, survivor gameplay is so similar between matches that the perks help, but it isn't like you aren't able to play the game if you don't have "the meta" unlocked on a certain character. But that is a barrier to entry, when a lot of your peers have been playing this game for three years now, and meanwhile you're new to the game, wishing you could be like them.

So just go into it knowing that there's a decent grind if you want to get "up there". But outside of that, in general gameplay and such - it's a blast. Killing is a challenge but rewarding, surviving can also be a challenge, and is rewarding. If you have friends to play with the game gets considerably more fun. There's loads of guides and streamers to help get a hang of the game if you're having a hard time of getting started. And once you do get generally started, and get the grasp of the game and start lasting a little longer per chase, it really does get just a lot of fun.

The reason this game is always 50% off is because they need fresh meat for a boring grinder, this must be the most bought and quit playing game in the world. there are a 1000 things to learn  with no instruction 999 of them work against being a survivor and in the killers favor and you'll find your self doing nothing but watching from the hook wondering how he knew you were there this time. maybe 1/30 matches are fun or equal and you level up even for losing so the killers you face are only harder with even better perks.. here is a typical game for ya.. not edited by twitch streamers
 at least one person on your team will disconnect during the match leave and impossible 3 vs killer.
the killer then hooks 1 of the 3 and camps there waiting for someone to save him 
killer then hits you as your being pulled off the hook and simply puts you back up and game over 
he then kills the person who went for the save for exposing themselves leaving one person hoping that a magic hatch will spawn next to them and thats only if the survivor hid the whole time waiting for you to die instead of playing and helping. but mostly the other two guys just die trying to save each other. rinse and repeat..
